docs.title: AZD for AI Developers Workshop
docs.text:
Welcome to the hands-on workshop for learning Azure Developer CLI (AZD) with a focus on AI application deployment. This workshop helps you gain an applied understanding of AZD templates in 3 steps:

  1. Discovery - find the template that is right for you.
  2. Deployment - deploy and validate that it works
  3. Customization - modify and iterate to make it yours!

Over the course of this workshop, you will also be introduced to core developer tools and workflows, to help you streamline your end-to-end development journey.

docs.title: Browser-Based Guide
docs.text:
The workshop lessons are in Markdown. You can navigate them directly in GitHub - or launch a browser-based preview as shown in the screenshot below.

To use this option - fork the repository to your profile, and launch GitHub Codespaces. Once the VS Code terminal is active, type this command:

mkdocs serve > /dev/null 2>&1 &

In a few seconds, you will see a pop-up dialog. Select the option to Open in browser. The web-based guide will now open in a new browser tab. Some benefits of this preview:

  1. Built-in search - find keywords or lessons quickly.
  2. Copy icon - hover over codeblocks to see this option
  3. Theme toggle - switch between dark and light themes
  4. Get help - click the Discord icon in footer to join!

docs.title: Workshop Overview
docs.text:
Duration: 3-4 hours Level: Beginner to Intermediate Prerequisites: Familiarity with Azure, AI concepts, VS Code & command-line tools.

This is a hands-on workshop where you learn by doing. Once you have completed the exercises, we recommend reviewing the AZD For Beginners curriculum to continue your learning journey into Security and Productivity best practices.

Time Module Objective -- 00. Workshop Outline Complete workshop structure and learning path 15 mins 01. AZD Fundamentals Set the stage, understand the goals 30 mins 02. Select Template Explore options and pick starter 30 mins 03. Validate Template Deploy default solution to Azure 30 mins 04. Deconstruct Template Explore structure and configuration 30 mins 05. Configure Template Activate and try available features 30 mins 06. Customize Template Adapt the template to your needs 30 mins 07. Teardown Resources Cleanup and release resources 15 mins 08. Next Steps Learning resources, Workshop challenge

docs.title: What You'll Learn
docs.text:
Think of the AZD Template as a learning sandbox to explore various capabilities and tools for end-to-end development on Azure AI Foundry. By the end of this workshop, you should have an intuitive sense for various tools and concepts in this context.

Concept Objective Azure Developer CLI Understand tool commands and workflows AZD Templates Understand project structure and config Azure AI Agent Provision & deploy Azure AI Foundry project Azure AI Search Enable context engineering with agents Observability Explore tracing, monitoring and evaluations Red Teaming Explore adversarial testing and mitigations

docs.title: Workshop Structure
docs.text: The workshop is structured to take you on a journey from template discovery, to deployment, deconstruction, and customization - using the official Getting Started with AI Agents starter template as the basis.

docs.title: 01. AZD Fundamentals (15 mins)
docs.text:
• What is Azure Developer CLI?
  • Why use AZD for AI applications?
  • Workshop overview and prerequisites
  • Setup: Verify environment access

docs.title: 02. Select Template (30 mins)
docs.text:
• What are AI Templates?
  • Where can I find AI Templates?
  • How can I get started building AI Agents?
  • Lab: Quickstart with GitHub Codespaces

docs.title: 03. Validate Template (30 mins)
docs.text:
• What is the AI Template Architecture?
  • What is the AZD Development Workflow?
  • How can I get help with AZD Development?
  • Lab: Deploy & Validate AI Agents template

docs.title: 04. Deconstruct Template (30 mins)
docs.text:
• Explore your environment in .azure/
  • Explore your resource setup in infra/
  • Explore your AZD configuration in azure.yamls
  • Lab: Modify Environment Variables & Redeploy

docs.title: 05. Configure Template (30 mins)
docs.text:
• Explore: Retrieval Augmented Generation
  • Explore: Agent Evaluation & Red Teaming
  • Explore: Tracing & Monitoring
  • Lab: Explore AI Agent + Observability

docs.title: 06. Customize Template (30 mins)
docs.text:
• Define: PRD with Scenario Requirements
  • Configure: Environment Variables for AZD
  • Implement: Lifecycle Hooks for added tasks
  • Lab: Customize template for my scenario

docs.title: Workshop Challenge
docs.text:
Want to challenge yourself to do more? Here are some project suggestions - or share your ideas with us!!

Project Description 1. Deconstruct A Complex AI Template Use the workflow and tools we outlined and see if you can deploy, validate, and customize a different AI solution template. What did you learn? 2. Customize With Your Scenario Try writing a PRD (Product Requirements Document) for a different scenario. Then use GitHub Copilot in your template repo in Agent Model - and ask it to generate a customization workflow for you. What did you learn? How could you improve on these suggestions?

docs.title: 00. Workshop Outline
docs.text: Duration: 3-4 hours Level: Beginner to Intermediate

docs.title: Workshop Overview
docs.text: This hands-on workshop teaches you how to build, deploy, and customize AI agent applications using Azure Developer CLI (AZD) and Azure AI Foundry.

docs.title: What You'll Build
docs.text:
A production-ready AI agent application with:

  • 🤖 Intelligent conversational AI using Azure AI Foundry
  • 🔍 Knowledge retrieval with RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation)
  • 📊 Monitoring and tracing capabilities
  • 🔒 Built-in evaluation and safety features
  • ☁️ Deployed on Azure Container Apps

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Azure subscription with Owner or Contributor permissions
  • GitHub account (for Codespaces)
  • Basic familiarity with command-line tools
  • Understanding of AI concepts (helpful but not required)

docs.title: Workshop Modules
docs.text: # Module Duration Objectives 01 AZD Fundamentals 15 min Understand AZD, AI agents, and workshop goals 02 Select Template 30 min Discover AI templates and launch Codespaces 03 Validate Template 30 min Deploy the template and verify it works 04 Deconstruct Template 30 min Explore project structure and configuration 05 Configure Template 30 min Enable RAG, evaluation, and monitoring 06 Customize Template 30 min Adapt the template for your scenario 07 Teardown Resources 30 min Clean up Azure resources properly 08 Next Steps 15 min Explore challenges and learning paths

docs.title: 🎯 Phase 1: Discovery (Modules 1-2)
docs.text: Learn about Azure Developer CLI templates and select the AI agents starter template for hands-on work.

docs.title: 🚀 Phase 2: Deployment (Module 3)
docs.text: Deploy a complete AI application to Azure with a single command and validate that it works.

docs.title: 🔍 Phase 3: Understanding (Module 4)
docs.text: Deconstruct the template to understand its structure, configuration files, and infrastructure setup.

docs.title: ⚙️ Phase 4: Configuration (Module 5)
docs.text: Activate advanced features like vector search, tracing, monitoring, and AI evaluation.

docs.title: 🛠️ Phase 5: Customization (Module 6)
docs.text: Modify the template to implement your own AI application scenario.

docs.title: 🧹 Phase 6: Cleanup (Modules 7-8)
docs.text: Properly teardown resources, explore next steps, and tackle optional challenges.

docs.title: Key Technologies
docs.text:
You'll gain hands-on experience with:

  • Azure Developer CLI (azd) - Streamlined deployment workflows
  • Azure AI Foundry - AI project and agent management
  • Azure OpenAI / AI Models - GPT-4o and embedding models
  • Azure AI Search - Vector search for RAG scenarios
  • Azure Container Apps - Serverless container hosting
  • Application Insights - Monitoring and tracing
  • Bicep - Infrastructure as Code

docs.title: Azure Developer CLI Skills
docs.text: ✅ Template discovery and initialization ✅ Environment configuration management ✅ Provisioning infrastructure with IaC ✅ Deploying applications to Azure ✅ Resource lifecycle management

docs.title: AI Development Skills
docs.text: ✅ Creating AI agents with Azure AI Foundry ✅ Implementing RAG with vector search ✅ Enabling observability and tracing ✅ Running evaluations for quality and safety ✅ Customizing AI applications for scenarios

  2. Customize for Your Scenario - Build an AI agent for your use case
  3. Add New Features - Integrate additional Azure services
  4. Optimize Performance - Tune model parameters and improve response quality

docs.title: 01: Try Azure Developer CLI
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will install the Azure Developer CLI (azd) on your development environment, authenticate with Azure, and explore core azd commands. You'll learn how to check your installation, view available templates, and understand the basic workflow of using azd as your "general contractor" for Azure deployments.

docs.title: 02: Explore AZD Templates
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the structure and components of azd templates. You'll examine key files like azure.yaml, understand the infra/ and src/ folder organization, and identify what makes a template reusable. This lab will help you recognize patterns across different template types and understand how templates serve as blueprints for Azure solutions.

docs.title: 03: Discover Template Sources
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will navigate official azd template galleries including the Awesome AZD collection and Azure AI App Templates. You'll learn how to search for templates based on technology stack, filter by use case, and evaluate template quality indicators like stars, recent updates, and documentation completeness.

docs.title: 04: Select Your Template
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will apply evaluation criteria to select the most appropriate azd template for the retail chatbot scenario. You'll compare architecture diagrams, review feature lists, assess tech stack compatibility, and make an informed decision on which starter template best matches your requirements.

docs.title: 05: Setup GitHub Codespaces
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will create a GitHub Codespace for your selected azd template. You'll fork the template repository, launch a cloud-based development environment, explore the devcontainer configuration, and verify that all required tools and dependencies are installed and ready for development.

docs.title: 06: Deploy Your Application
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will execute your first full deployment using azd. You'll authenticate with Azure, set environment variables, run 'azd up' to provision infrastructure and deploy the application, and monitor the deployment process. You'll learn to interpret deployment logs and troubleshoot common issues.

docs.title: 07: Validate App Features
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will verify that your deployment was successful by checking Azure resources in the portal, testing application endpoints, and validating AI chatbot functionality. You'll review deployment logs, check resource configurations, and perform essential health checks to ensure everything is working correctly.

docs.title: 08: Explore the Application
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will interact with your deployed application through its user interface. You'll submit sample queries to the chatbot, observe how requests flow from frontend to backend, explore different features, and understand how the various components work together to deliver the AI-powered experience.

docs.title: 09: Explore azure.yaml
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will examine the azure.yaml manifest file in detail. You'll identify service definitions, understand hooks and event handlers, learn about environment variables, and see how this file orchestrates the entire deployment workflow. You'll also practice modifying the manifest to add custom configurations.

docs.title: 10: Explore Infra Folder
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will dive into the infra/ folder to understand infrastructure-as-code. You'll examine Bicep files, identify Azure resources being provisioned, understand module organization and parameters, and learn how to modify infrastructure definitions to add or change Azure services.

docs.title: 11: Explore Src Folder
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will navigate the src/ directory to understand the application code structure. You'll identify frontend and backend components, trace how the application integrates with Azure services, locate configuration files, and understand how environment variables are used for service authentication.

docs.title: 12: Explore .azure Folder
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the .azure/ folder to understand how azd manages deployment state and environment-specific configurations. You'll examine .env files, learn about sensitive information storage, and practice managing multiple environments (dev, staging, production) using azd environment commands.

docs.title: 13: Explore README
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will thoroughly review the template's README and documentation. You'll interpret architecture diagrams, identify prerequisites, follow setup instructions, review the troubleshooting guide, and learn how to find answers to common questions. This lab emphasizes the importance of documentation in understanding and maintaining templates.

docs.title: 14: Add an AI Agent
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will integrate an AI agent into your application. You'll configure agent capabilities, define custom instructions and tools, connect the agent to your data sources, and test agent responses. You'll learn how agents differ from simple chatbots and how to validate agent behavior.

docs.title: 15: Add AI Search
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will provision Azure AI Search resources and configure search indexes for your product catalog. You'll implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) patterns, populate indexes with sample data, tune search parameters, and test how search enhances your chatbot's ability to provide accurate, grounded responses.

docs.title: 16: Add AI Models
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will deploy Azure OpenAI models to your solution. You'll configure model endpoints, manage API keys, compare different models (GPT-4, GPT-4o, GPT-3.5), and set up fallback configurations. You'll learn how to optimize model selection based on cost, performance, and use case requirements.

docs.title: 17: Add Evaluations
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will implement AI evaluation frameworks to assess your chatbot's quality. You'll define evaluation metrics for relevance, coherence, and groundedness, create test datasets with diverse customer queries, run automated evaluations, and analyze results to identify areas for improvement.

docs.title: 18: Add Tracing & Monitoring
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will enable Application Insights for comprehensive observability. You'll configure distributed tracing for your AI agent application, create monitoring dashboards for key metrics, set up alerts for critical issues, and learn how to use telemetry data to troubleshoot production problems.

docs.title: 19: Add Red Teaming
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will implement security testing for your AI chatbot. You'll learn about common AI vulnerabilities like prompt injection and jailbreaking, configure PyRIT or similar tools for automated security scanning, run red team tests, and implement mitigations to protect your application from adversarial attacks.

docs.title: 20: Customize a Template
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will customize your template to add new features specific to your retail scenario. You'll plan modifications, update both application code and infrastructure resources, test changes locally, redeploy using azd, and document your customizations for team collaboration.

docs.title: 21: Create New Template
docs.text: In this hands-on lab, you will apply the complete deconstruction process to a new azd template of your choice. You'll select a different template, deploy it, analyze its structure, compare it with your previous template, and build confidence in quickly understanding and adapting unfamiliar codebases.

docs.title: 👋🏽 Welcome
docs.text:
DECONSTRUCT TO LEARN!

Level: Beginner-Intermediate Duration: 3-4 hours

Building enterprise-grade AI solutions requires knowledge of design architecture, infrastructure provisioning, environment configuration, and more. As a beginner, where do you even start? In this workshop, we'll teach you how to use the Azure Developer CLI (azd) with AI App Templates to achieve this in 4 steps:

  1. Discover It - learn azd fundamentals, find the right azd "starter" template.
  2. Deploy It - use azd to deploy solution to Azure, validate that it works!
  3. Deconstruct It - use azd (and AI assistance) to understand codebase & workflow.
  4. Customize It - modify app source and infra resources to adapt it for your needs.

Once you've complete this, challenge yourself to replicate the process with another AI App Template - and continue to build your intuition by using this repository as a learning sandbox.

docs.title: 1. Before We Begin
docs.text:
For the best experience, we recommend you start with three steps:

  1. Review pre-requisites - and create required accounts if needed.
  2. Launch GitHub Codespaces - get a pre-built development environment.
  3. Launch Mkdocs Preview - get a workshop guide in the browser.

Then continue following workshop instructions in the browser-based guide. You can get the benefits of search, dark theme, and helpful admonitions that highlight key tasks, provide AI-assistance tips, and easy copy-paste functionality for code and commands.

To get the most out of this workshop, you will needt the following:

  • Familiarity with - VS Code, Azure, Python & CLI tools

docs.text:
You need a development environment with the right tools and dependencies installed. The repository is instrumented with a devcontainer.json that defines these requirements. You can activate this in GitHub Codespaces in just a few clicks:

  1. Start by creating a fork of this repo in your personal GitHub profile.
  2. Next, navigate to the fork in the browser - and click the "Code" button.
  3. Then, select "Codespaces" and click the "+" button to create a new codespace.
  4. You should see a Visual Studio Code IDE in a new tab - wait till it loads.
  5. You should see a Visual Studio Code terminal open - wait for active prompt.

Congratulations! Your development environment is ready to use! ✅

docs.title: 1.3 Launch Instructions
docs.text:
You need an easy way to navigate instructions, search for relevant information, and copy-paste required code or instructions. This repository is instrumented with an mkdocs.yml that renders the docs in an interactive website format with a single command:

  1. Start by opening the VS Code terminal in your active Codespaces tab
  2. Run this command - and watch for a pop-up dialog to appear (in a few seconds). 
    nohup mkdocs serve > /dev/null 2>&1 &
  3. Confirm "Open in Browser" in dialog - you should see a website like this:
  4. Click Launch Instructions in Table Of Contents to get to this same step.
  5. Now continue following instructions using the web-based workshop guide

Congratulations! Your workshop guide is ready for you to explore! ✅

docs.title: 2. Workshop Outline
docs.text: Everyone learns differently. Here are three things that can help you apply different learning techniques to build your intuition for the Azure Developer CLI tools and workflows.

docs.title: 2.1 Application Scenario
docs.text:
Let's start by defining an application scenario for the solution we want. Having a concrete use case allows us to contextualize what we learn in a more practical way.

SCENARIO: RETAIL CUSTOMER SUPPORT CHATBOT

You are an AI engineer working for an enterprise retail company that sells products on their online website. You have been asked to build an AI chatbot that has a web-based UI/UX and can answer questions grounded in your product data. Your team wants to make this an AI Agent application - and wants to make sure the architecture is setup to allow end-to-end observability for trustworthy AI delivery. What do you do?

docs.title: 2.2 Home-Building Analogy
docs.text:
Where do you even start? One way to tackle a complex problem is to find a relevant analogy that can help you reframe issues or solutions in more familiar ways. Let's try this out.

ANALOGY: BUILDING AI SOLUTIONS IS LIKE BUILDING A HOME

  1. I need a general contractor - Instead of doing everything myself, I need an expert who can manage the resources and schedules, and execute the plan. This is the Azure Developer CLI (azd).
  2. I need a design blueprint - Instead of starting from scratch, I want to look for a "starter" home design that I like and give that to my contractor as the basis to build on. This is your azd template.
  3. I need building materials - I need to decide what fixture and utilities I need and provide my preferences on how they should be installed and configured. This is your infrastrcture-as-code (infra/ folder).
  4. I need interior design - Once the house is in place, I need to decorate it with my things to provide the right user experience for my visitors. This is your application code (src/ folder).
  5. I need a build schedule - This is the construction plan and manifest showing me how the blueprint maps to the materials, and outlining the order in which things get done. This is your configuration file (azure.yaml)
  6. I need to store permits & status - This is how I track the current state of my construction and keep information about various accounts for status checks. _This is your .azure folder (with a .env file)

You can now make other connections. For instance:

  1. Starter templates are like starter homes. Use them to get familiar with maintenance.
  2. Template customization is like updating your current home to meet new requirements.
  3. Template discovery is like moving to a new home when your current one gets outdated.

docs.title: 2.3 Deconstruct To Learn
docs.text:
Now it's time to learn by doing. Typical tutorials will teach you to build up from fundamentals. In this workshop, we'll look at how to deconstruct an existing working solution to figure out how it works. Then reconstruct it to suit our requirements.

We'll follow the four-step process outline below. Click each tab to see the lessons involved:
